summary: Scots is a language spoken in Scotland and Northern Ireland, with around 1.5 million speakers in Scotland. It's part of the Germanic language family and is closely related to English, but it has its own unique features. Some call it a dialect of English, while others consider it a separate language, like how Norwegian is related to Danish. Scots has its own dialects, and it's recognized by the Scottish government as an official language. It's mainly spoken in the Lowlands and Northern Isles of Scotland.
title: Scots language
